MCQ: What term was coined in 1959 by Arthur Samuel?
choices: a: Artificial intelligence | b: Machine learning | c: Computer gaming | d: Self-teaching computers

MCQ: Who introduced a theoretical neural structure formed by interactions among nerve cells?
choices: a: Arthur Samuel | b: Donald Hebb | c: Walter Pitts | d: Warren McCulloch

MCQ: In the 1960s, a learning machine called Cybertron was developed to analyze which of the following?
choices: a: Sonar signals | b: Electrocardiograms | c: Speech patterns | d: All of the above

MCQ: According to Tom M. Mitchell, what is the definition of machine learning?
choices: a: Improving computer performance | b: Learning from experience | c: Developing algorithms | d: Classifying data

MCQ: What are the two objectives of modern-day machine learning?
choices: a: Classifying data and making predictions | b: Developing algorithms and improving performance | c: Analyzing patterns and recognizing symbols | d: Training neural networks and using computer vision
